data.Title: Google Search Experiencing Indexing Issues and Volatility
data.Description: Google Search is reportedly experiencing a bug that is preventing new content from being indexed. This follows reports of weekend ranking volatility, reminiscent of a bug Google had late last year into early this year.

data.Title: Google Updates URL Best Practices and Algorithm Insights
data.Description: Google updated its URL best practices, adding a recommendation to avoid using fragments for changing page content. Additionally, the company introduced "Mouse brain," a new term in the context of search algorithms, alongside existing terms like Rankbrain and Spambrain.

data.Title: Google Search Console Bug Sends Multiple "New Owner" Notifications
data.Description: Google Search Console experienced a bug that sent multiple and repeated "new owner" email notifications over the past few days. Google is aware of the issue and is working on a resolution.

data.Title: Bing Search Testing Nutritional Labels on Images
data.Description: Bing is testing adding nutritional details to images in its search results. It includes labeling food products with "high calcium," "lean protein," "anti-inflammatory," and other labels.

data.Title: Google Ads to Migrate from Country of Sale to Feed Labels
data.Description: Google Ads and Merchant Center will transition from the "Country of Sale" attribute to a new Feed label functionality in August 2024. This change aims to provide more flexibility and granularity in targeting options for advertisers.

data.Title: Google Ads Reverses Policy on Opioid Painkiller Ads
data.Description: After initially announcing that it would allow ads for Opioid painkillers, Google Ads has indefinitely paused this policy update. The decision comes after receiving feedback and concerns from various stakeholders.

data.Title: TUAW Domain Revived for AI-Generated Content Farm
data.Description: The Unofficial Apple Weblog (TUAW) domain is back, but ad agency Web Orange has turned it into a content farm using AI-generated copy and stolen bylines from former writers.
